alert.note: Alert for Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued December 14 at 2:26AM MST until December 15 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 5 PM MST WEDNESDAY FOR THE NORTHEAST AND EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO VERY STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .A fast moving but very dynamic storm system and associated cold front will pass over New Mexico tonight and Wednesday. Peak wind speeds in excess of 60 mph are possible over northeast and east central New Mexico Wednesday afternoon and will be combined with low humidities and above normal temperatures. Critical fire weather conditions will be most likely in the East Central Plains along and north of I-40. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 5 PM MST WEDNESDAY... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 11 AM to 5 PM MST Wednesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Plains from midday Wednesday to around sunset early Wednesday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West 30 to 45 mph with gusts to around 60 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...10 to 15 percent * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
